description: A big list of common EMVco tags that apply to all kernels
name: Common EMVco tags

info.description: The number that identifies the major industry and the card issuer and that forms the first part of the Primary Account Number (PAN)
info.name: Issuer Identification Number (IIN)

info.description: Mnemonic associated with AID according to [ISO 7816-5]. Used in application selection. Application Label is optional in the File Control Information (FCI) of an Application Definition File (ADF) and optional in an ADF directory entry.
info.name: Application Label

info.description: A path may reference any file. It is a concatenation of file identifiers. The path begins with the identifier of a DF (the MF for an absolute path or the current DF for a relative path) and ends with the identifier of the file itself.
info.name: Path

info.description: Track 1 Data contains the data objects of the track 1 according to [ISO/IEC 7813] Structure B, excluding start sentinel, end sentinel and LRC. The Track 1 Data may be present in the file read using the READ RECORD command during a mag-stripe mode transaction.
info.name: Track 1 Data

info.description: Contains the data elements of track 2 according to ISO/IEC 7813, excluding start sentinel, end sentinel, and Longitudinal Redundancy Check (LRC), as follows:Primary Account NumberField Separator (Hex 'D')Expiration Date (YYMM)Service CodeDiscretionary Data (defined by individual payment systems)Pad with one Hex 'F' if needed to ensure whole bytes
info.name: Track 2 Equivalent Data

info.description: Valid cardholder account number
info.name: Application Primary Account Number (PAN)

info.description: Indicates cardholder name according to ISO 7813
info.name: Cardholder Name
Track 1, identical to the data coded
Track 2, identical to the data coded
Track 3, identical to the data coded

info.description: Date after which the card application expires.
info.name: Application Expiration Date

info.description: Date from which the application may be used. The date is expressed in the YYMMDD format.
info.name: Application Effective Date

info.description: Indicates the country of the issuer according to ISO 3166-1
info.name: Issuer Country Code

info.description: Indicates the currency code of the transaction according to [ISO 4217]
info.name: Transaction Currency Code

info.description: 1-4 languages stored in order of preference, each represented by 2 lower case alphabetical characters according to ISO 639-1.
info.name: Language Preference

info.description: Service code as defined in ISO/IEC 7813 for Track 1 and Track 2
info.name: Service Code

info.description: Identifies and differentiates cards with the same PAN
info.name: Application Primary Account Number (PAN) Sequence Number (PSN)

info.description: Representation of human sexes through a language-neutral single-digit code (0 = not known, 1 = male, 2 = female, 9 = not applicable)
info.name: Sex (ISO 5218)
Static internal authentication - first associated data
Static internal authentication - second associated data

info.description: Identifies the common currency used by the terminal
info.name: Transaction Reference Currency Code

info.description: Identifies the decimal point position from the right of the terminal common currency
info.name: Transaction Reference Currency Exponent

info.description: The URL provides the location of the Issuer's Library Server on the Internet.
info.name: Issuer Uniform resource locator (URL)

info.description: Uniquely identifies the account of a customer at a financial institution as defined in ISO 13616.
info.name: International Bank Account Number (IBAN)

info.description: Uniquely identifies a bank as defined in ISO 9362.
info.name: Bank Identifier Code (BIC)

info.description: Indicates the country of the issuer as defined in ISO 3166 (using a 2 character alphabetic code)
info.name: Issuer Country Code (alpha2 format)

info.description: Indicates the country of the issuer as defined in ISO 3166 (using a 3 character alphabetic code)
info.name: Issuer Country Code (alpha3 format)
Commitment (e.g., a positive number less than the public RSA modulus in use)
Challenge (e.g., a number, possibly zero, less than the public RSA exponent in use)
Response (e.g., a positive number less than the public RSA modulus in use)
Committed challenge (e.g., the hash-code of a commitment data object)
Authentication code (e.g., the hash-code of one or more data fields and a commitment data object)
Exponential (e.g., a public positive number for establishing a session key by a DH method)

info.description: Template containing one or more data objects relevant to an application directory entry according to [ISO 7816-5].
info.name: Application Template/Directory Entry

info.description: Identifies the FCP template according to ISO/IEC 7816-4
info.name: File Control Parameters (FCP) Template
Number of data bytes in the file, excluding structural information
Number of data bytes in the file, including structural information if any
Proprietary information, primitive encoding (i.e., not coded in BER-TLV)
Identifier of an EF containing an extension of the file control information
Security attribute referencing the expanded format
Identifier of an EF containing security environment templates
Template, Security attribute for data objects
Template, Security attribute for physical interfaces
One or more pairs of data objects, short EF identifier (tag 88) - absolute or relative path (tag 51)
Delay indicators, for detecting an end of message
Delay indicators, for detecting an absence of response

info.description: Identifies the FCI template according to ISO/IEC 7816-4
info.name: File Control Information (FCI) Template

info.description: Template containing the data objects returned by the Card in response to a READ RECORD command. Contains the contents of the record read. (Mandatory for SFIs 1-10. Response messages for SFIs 11-30 are outside the scope of EMV, but may use template '70')
info.name: READ RECORD Response Message Template

info.description: Contains proprietary issuer data for transmission to the ICC before the second GENERATE AC command
info.name: Issuer Script Template 1

info.description: Contains proprietary issuer data for transmission to the ICC after the second GENERATE AC command
info.name: Issuer Script Template 2

info.description: Issuer discretionary part of the directory according to ISO/IEC 7816-5
info.name: Directory Discretionary Template

info.description: Contains the data objects (with tags and lengths) returned by the ICC in response to a command
info.name: Response Message Template Format 2

info.description: see 6.4
info.name: Template, Security Support (SS)

info.description: see 6.5
info.name: Template, Security Environment (SE)

info.description: see 6
info.name: Template, Secure Messaging (SM)
Algorithm reference as used in control reference data objects for secure messaging
RSA Modulus (a number denoted as n coded on x bytes), or DSA First prime (a number denoted as p coded on y bytes), or ECDSA Prime (a number denoted as p coded on z bytes)
RSA Public exponent (a number denoted as v, e.g., 65537), or DSA Second prime (a number denoted as q dividing p-1, e.g., 20 bytes), or ECDSA First coefficient (a number denoted as a coded on z bytes)
DSA Basis (a number denoted as g of order q coded on y bytes), or ECDSA Second coefficient (a number denoted as b coded on z bytes)
DSA Public key (a number denoted as y equal to g to the power x mod p where x is the private key coded on y bytes), or ECDSA Generator (a point denoted as PB on the curve, coded on 2z bytes)
ECDSA Order (a prime number denoted as q, order of the generator PB, coded on z bytes)
ECDSA Public key (a point denoted as PP on the curve, equal to x times PB where x is the private key, coded on 2z bytes)

info.description: Contains the data objects (without tags and lengths) returned by the ICC in response to a command
info.name: Response Message Template Format 1

info.description: Authorised amount of the transaction (excluding adjustments)
info.name: Amount, Authorised (Binary)

info.description: Indicates the capabilities of the card to support specific functions in the application.
info.name: Application Interchange Profile (AIP)

info.description: Identifies the data field of a command message
info.name: Command Template

info.description: Identifies the name of the DF as described in ISO/IEC 7816-4
info.name: Dedicated File (DF) Name

info.description: Contains a command for transmission to the ICC
info.name: Issuer Script Command

info.description: Indicates the priority of a given application or group of applications in a directory
info.name: Application Priority Indicator

info.description: Identifies the AEF referenced in commands related to a given ADF or DDF. It is a binary data object having a value in the range 1 to 30 and with the three high order bits set to zero.
info.name: Short File Identifier (SFI)

info.description: Nonzero value generated by the issuer for an approved transaction.
info.name: Authorisation Code

info.description: Data element generated by the Issuer Host System or the Reader indicating the disposition of the transaction.
info.name: Authorisation Response Code (ARC)

info.description: List of data objects (tag and length) to be passed to the ICC in the first GENERATE AC command
info.name: Card Risk Management Data Object List 1 (CDOL1)

info.description: List of data objects (tag and length) to be passed to the ICC in the second GENERATE AC command
info.name: Card Risk Management Data Object List 2 (CDOL2)

info.description: Identifies a prioritised list of methods of verification of the cardholder supported by the card application.
info.name: Cardholder Verification Method (CVM) List

info.description: Identifies the Certificate Authority's public key in conjunction with the RID for use in offline data authentication.
info.name: Certification Authority Public Key Index (PKI)

info.description: Issuer's public key certified by a certificate authority for use in offline data authentication.
info.name: Issuer Public Key Certificate

info.description: Issuer data transmitted to card for online Issuer authentication.
info.name: Issuer Authentication Data

info.description: Digital signature on critical application parameters that is used in static data authentication (SDA).
info.name: Signed Static Application Data (SAD)

info.description: Indicates the location (SFI, range of records) of the AEFs related to a given application.
info.name: Application File Locator (AFL)

info.description: Status of the different functions as seen from the terminal.
info.name: Terminal Verification Results (TVR)

groups.name: Offline data authentication was not performed
Card appears on terminal exception file
ICC and terminal have different application versions
Requested service not allowed for card product
PIN entry required and PIN pad not present or not working
PIN entry required, PIN pad present, but PIN was not entered
Transaction selected randomly for online processing
Script processing failed before final GENERATE AC
Script processing failed after final GENERATE AC

info.description: List of data objects (tag and length) to be used by the terminal in generating the TC Hash Value
info.name: Transaction Certificate Data Object List (TDOL)

info.description: Result of a hash function specified in Book 2, Annex B3.1
info.name: Transaction Certificate (TC) Hash Value

info.description: Data entered by the cardholder for the purpose of the PIN verification
info.name: Transaction Personal Identification Number (PIN) Data

info.description: Local date that the transaction was authorised
info.name: Transaction Date

info.description: Indicates the functions performed in a transaction
info.name: Transaction Status Information (TSI)

info.description: Indicates the type of financial transaction, represented by the first two digits of the ISO 8583:1987 Processing Code. The actual values to be used for the Transaction Type data element are defined by the relevant payment system
info.name: Transaction Type

info.description: Identifies the name of a DF associated with a directory
info.name: Directory Definition File (DDF) Name

info.description: Uniquely identifies the acquirer within each payment system
info.name: Acquirer Identifier

info.description: Authorised amount of the transaction. Requested in CDOL1.
info.name: Amount, Authorised (Numeric)

info.description: Secondary amount associated with the transaction representing a cashback amount. Requested in CDOL1.
info.name: Amount, Other (Numeric)

info.description: Secondary amount associated with the transaction representing a cashback amount
info.name: Amount, Other (Binary)

info.description: Issuer or payment system specified data relating to the application
info.name: Application Discretionary Data

info.description: Identifies the application as described in ISO/IEC 7816-5
info.name: Application Identifier (AID), Terminal

info.description: Indicates issuer's specified restrictions on the geographic usage and services allowed for the application
info.name: Application Usage Control (AUC)

info.description: Version number assigned by the payment system for the application in the Card
info.name: Application Version Number

info.description: Version number assigned by the payment system for the Kernel application
info.name: Application Version Number

info.description: Indicates the whole cardholder name when greater than 26 characters using the same coding convention as in ISO 7813
info.name: Cardholder Name - Extended

info.description: Specifies conditions that cause a transaction to be declined if it might have been approved online, but the Reader is unable to process the transaction online.
info.name: Issuer Action Code - Default

groups.name: Offline data authentication was not performed
Card appears on terminal exception file
ICC and terminal have different application versions
Requested service not allowed for card product
PIN entry required and PIN pad not present or not working
PIN entry required, PIN pad present, but PIN was not entered
Transaction selected randomly for online processing
Script processing failed before final GENERATE AC
Script processing failed after final GENERATE AC

info.description: Specifies the issuer's conditions that cause the denial of a transaction without attempt to go online
info.name: Issuer Action Code - Denial

groups.name: Offline data authentication was not performed
Card appears on terminal exception file
ICC and terminal have different application versions
Requested service not allowed for card product
PIN entry required and PIN pad not present or not working
PIN entry required, PIN pad present, but PIN was not entered
Transaction selected randomly for online processing
Script processing failed before final GENERATE AC
Script processing failed after final GENERATE AC

info.description: Specifies the issuer's conditions that cause a transaction to be transmitted online
info.name: Issuer Action Code - Online

groups.name: Offline data authentication was not performed
Card appears on terminal exception file
ICC and terminal have different application versions
Requested service not allowed for card product
PIN entry required and PIN pad not present or not working
PIN entry required, PIN pad present, but PIN was not entered
Transaction selected randomly for online processing
Script processing failed before final GENERATE AC
Script processing failed after final GENERATE AC

info.description: Contains proprietary application data for transmission to the Issuer in an online transaction.
info.name: Issuer Application Data (IAD)

info.description: Indicates the code table according to ISO/IEC 8859 for displaying the Application Preferred Name
info.name: Issuer Code Table Index

info.description: Preferred mnemonic associated with the AID
info.name: Application Preferred Name

info.description: ATC value of the last transaction that went online
info.name: Last Online Application Transaction Counter (ATC) Register

info.description: Issuer-specified preference for the maximum number of consecutive offline transactions for this ICC application allowed in a terminal with online capability
info.name: Lower Consecutive Offline Limit (LCOL)

info.description: Classifies the type of business being done by the merchant, represented according to ISO 8583:1993 for Card Acceptor Business Code
info.name: Merchant Category Code (MCC)

info.description: When concatenated with the Acquirer Identifier, uniquely identifies a given merchant
info.name: Merchant Identifier

info.description: Number of PIN tries remaining
info.name: Personal Identification Number (PIN) Try Counter

info.description: Identification of the Issuer Script.
info.name: Issuer Script Identifier

info.description: Indicates the country of the terminal, represented according to ISO 3166. Requested in CDOL1.
info.name: Terminal Country Code

info.description: Indicates the floor limit in the terminal in conjunction with the AID
info.name: Terminal Floor Limit

info.description: Designates the unique location of a Terminal at a merchant
info.name: Terminal Identification

info.description: Application-specific value used by the card for risk management purposes
info.name: Terminal Risk Management Data

groups.name: Enciphered PIN verification performed by ICC (Contactless)
Plaintext PIN verification performed by ICC (Contactless)
Enciphered PIN verification performed by ICC (Contact)
Plaintext PIN verification performed by ICC (Contact)
Mag-stripe mode contactless transactions not supported
EMV mode contactless transactions not supported

info.description: Unique and permanent serial number assigned to the IFD by the manufacturer
info.name: Interface Device (IFD) Serial Number

info.description: Discretionary part of track 1 according to ISO/IEC 7813
info.name: Track 1 Discretionary Data

info.description: Discretionary part of track 2 according to ISO/IEC 7813
info.name: Track 2 Discretionary Data

info.description: Local time at which the transaction was authorised.
info.name: Transaction Time

info.description: Identifies the Certificate Authority's public key in conjunction with the RID for use in offline static and dynamic data authentication.
info.name: Certification Authority Public Key Index (PKI)

info.description: Issuer-specified preference for the maximum number of consecutive offline transactions for this ICC application allowed in a terminal without online capability
info.name: Upper Consecutive Offline Limit (UCOL)

info.description: Payment Account Reference: EMV contact and contactless chip specifications products may support PAR by assigning a unique EMV tag (9F24) to represent PAR. PAR SHALL be required personalisation data for payment tokens but will be optional for terminals to read and transmit.
info.name: Payment Account Reference (PAR) generated or linked directly to the provision request in the token vault

info.description: Cryptogram returned by the card in response of the GENERATE AC command.
info.name: Application Cryptogram (AC)

info.description: Indicates the type of cryptogram and the actions to be performed by the terminal after the GENERATE AC command.
info.name: Cryptogram Information Data (CID)

info.description: The value to be appended to the ADF Name in the data field of the SELECT command, if the Extended Selection Support flag is present and set to 1. Content is payment system proprietary.
info.name: Extended Selection

info.description: Indicates the card's preference for the kernel on which the contactless application can be processed.
info.name: Kernel Identifier

info.description: ICC PIN Encipherment Public Key certified by the issuer
info.name: Integrated Circuit Card (ICC) PIN Encipherment Public Key Certificate

info.description: ICC PIN Encipherment Public Key Exponent used for PIN encipherment
info.name: Integrated Circuit Card (ICC) PIN Encipherment Public Key Exponent

info.description: Remaining digits of the ICC PIN Encipherment Public Key Modulus
info.name: Integrated Circuit Card (ICC) PIN Encipherment Public Key Remainder

info.description: Issuer public key exponent used for the verification of the Signed Static Application Data and the ICC Public Key Certificate
info.name: Issuer Public Key Exponent

info.description: Indicates the card data input, CVM, and security capabilities of the Terminal and Reader. The CVM capability (Byte 2) is instantiated with values depending on the transaction amount. The Terminal Capabilities is coded according to Annex A.2 of [EMV Book 4].
info.name: Terminal Capabilities

info.description: Indicates the results of the last CVM performed
info.name: Cardholder Verification Method (CVM) Results

info.description: Indicates the environment of the terminal, its communications capability, and its operational control
info.name: Terminal Type

info.description: Counter maintained by the application in the card (incrementing the ATC is managed by the card).
info.name: Application Transaction Counter (ATC)

info.description: Value to provide variability and uniqueness to the generation of the application cryptogram. Requested in CDOL1.
info.name: Unpredictable Number (UN)

info.description: List of terminal/reader-related data objects (tags and lengths) requested by the card to be transmitted in the GET PROCESSING OPTIONS command.
info.name: Processing Options Data Object List (PDOL)

info.description: Indicates the method by which the PAN was entered, according to the first two digits of the ISO 8583:1987 POS Entry Mode
info.name: Point-of-Service (POS) Entry Mode

info.description: Authorised amount expressed in the reference currency
info.name: Amount, Reference Currency (Binary)

info.description: 1-4 currency codes used between the terminal and the ICC when the Transaction Currency Code is different from the Application Currency Code; each code is 3 digits according to ISO 4217
info.name: Currency Code, Application Reference

info.description: Code defining the common currency used by the terminal in case the Transaction Currency Code is different from the Application Currency Code
info.name: Currency Code, Transaction Reference

info.description: Indicates the implied position of the decimal point from the right of the transaction amount, with the Transaction Reference Currency Code represented according to ISO 4217
info.name: Currency Exponent, Transaction Reference

info.description: Indicates the data input and output capabilities of the Terminal and Reader. The Additional Terminal Capabilities is coded according to Annex A.3 of [EMV Book 4].
info.name: Additional Terminal Capabilities (ATC)

info.description: Counter maintained by the terminal that is incremented by one for each transaction
info.name: Transaction Sequence Counter

info.description: Indicates the currency in which the account is managed according to ISO 4217
info.name: Currency Code, Application

info.description: Indicates the implied position of the decimal point from the right of the amount, for each of the 1-4 reference currencies represented according to ISO 4217
info.name: Currency Exponent, Application Reference

info.description: Indicates the implied position of the decimal point from the right of the amount represented according to ISO 4217
info.name: Currency Exponent, Application

info.description: An issuer assigned value that is retained by the terminal during the verification process of the Signed Static Application Data
info.name: Data Authentication Code

info.description: ICC Public Key certified by the issuer
info.name: Integrated Circuit Card (ICC) Public Key Certificate

info.description: Exponent ICC Public Key Exponent used for the verification of the Signed Dynamic Application Data
info.name: Integrated Circuit Card (ICC) Public Key Exponent

info.description: Digits of the ICC Public Key Modulus which do not fit within the ICC Public Key Certificate.
info.name: Integrated Circuit Card (ICC) Public Key Remainder

info.description: List of data objects (tag and length) to be passed to the ICC in the INTERNAL AUTHENTICATE command
info.name: Dynamic Data Authentication Data Object List (DDOL)

info.description: List of tags of primitive data objects defined in this specification whose value fields are to be included in the Signed Static or Dynamic Application Data
info.name: Static Data Authentication Tag List (SDA)

info.description: Digital signature on critical application parameters for DDA or CDA
info.name: Signed Dynamic Application Data (SDAD)

info.description: Time-variant number generated by the ICC, to be captured by the terminal
info.name: ICC Dynamic Number

info.description: Provides the SFI of the Transaction Log file and its number of records
info.name: Log Entry

info.description: Indicates the name and location of the merchant
info.name: Merchant Name and Location

info.description: List (in tag and length format) of data objects representing the logged data elements that are passed to the terminal when a transaction log record is read
info.name: Log Format

info.description: Payment system proprietary data element identifying the Application Program ID of the card application. When personalised, the Application Program ID is returned in the FCI Issuer Discretionary Data of the SELECT response (Tag BF0C'). EMV mode readers that support Dynamic Reader Limits (DRL) functionality examine the Application Program ID to determine the Reader Limit Set to apply.
info.name: Application Program Identifier (Program ID)

info.description: Indicates the results of Issuer Script processing. When the reader/terminal transmits this data element to the acquirer, in this version of Kernel 3, it is acceptable that only byte 1 is transmitted, although it is preferable for all five bytes to be transmitted.
info.name: Issuer Script Results

info.description: The Third Party Data contains various information, possibly including information from a third party. If present in the Card, the Third Party Data must be returned in a file read using the READ RECORD command or in the File Control Information Template. 'Device Type' is present when the most significant bit of byte 1 of 'Unique Identifier' is set to 0b. In this case, the maximum length of 'Proprietary Data' is 26 bytes. Otherwise it is 28 bytes.
info.name: Third Party Data

info.description: Visa proprietary data element specifying the maximum number of the consecutive offline international (those not in the country of issue) transactions allowed for that card application before a transaction goes online.
info.name: Consecutive Transaction Limit (InternationalCountry)

info.description: A decimal value used in a conversion algorithm to convert the Secondary Application Currency Code to the card's domestic (Application Currency Code). Issuer Script may be used to modify this data element.
info.name: Currency Conversion Parameters

info.description: Visa proprietary data element specifying the upper limit of the total amount of offline domestic transactions in the designated currency (Application Currency Code) and a secondary currency (Secondary Application Currency Code) allowed for that card application before a transaction is forced to go online. This limit is in the designated currency.
info.name: Cumulative Total Transaction Amount Limit-Dual Currency

info.description: Indicates a secondary currency to be converted to the designated currency in which the account is managed (Application Currency Code) according to ISO 4217.
info.name: Secondary Application Currency Code

info.description: A Visa proprietary data element, Issuer Limit for VLP available funds, is used to reset VLP Available Funds after an online approved transaction.
info.name: VLP Funds Limit

info.description: A Visa proprietary data element indicating the maximum amount allowed for single VLP transaction
info.name: VLP Single Transaction Limit

info.description: A counter that is decremented by the Amount Authorized when a VLP transaction is approved.
info.name: VLP Available Funds
Application life cycle data (8 first bytes)

info.description: Identifies the data object proprietary to this specification in the FCI template according to ISO/IEC 7816-4
info.name: File Control Information (FCI) Proprietary Template

info.description: Issuer discretionary part of the File Control Information Proprietary Template.
info.name: File Control Information (FCI) Issuer Discretionary Data
